"https://lnkd.in/g5tpQv7c"
""
"The Goals of the framework are to answer the following questions:"
"- Do I know the jobs I really should be doing in a system?"
"- Does the system have all the abilities it needs to successfully solve the problem set?"
"- Is this a fair, equitable, and enjoyable process for its human users?"
"- Are there external systems I can rely on to help solve the jobs?"
"- Are my systems and external ones doing a good job and trustworthy in many ways to solve problems?"
"- Can things be arbitrated fairly and equitably?"
"- How do human coworkers benefit from participation in the system immediately and long-term?"
"- Who owns the value generated by the system, and how is it reinvested back into the system to benefit all stakeholders?

Ok, so why not chatbots? Why not copilots? The naming convention here is poorly understood and there is even less consensus amongst that understanding! My take in how to think about these things are:"
""
"Copilots are Microsoft's product area. You can exists in this area as an agent, but the copilot controls the experience, the persona, and the access to data and services."
""
"Agents are the delivery paradigm. Knowledge sources exist to ground data for RAG operations, actions and connectors provide enterprise access to business data and processes. In these worlds, you will be a value add-on to the work that LLM leaders are doing to improve auto-generated experience, and at the end of the day your tools will be subservient to this."
""
"Companies absolutely will have the freedom to shake off the chains of the Copilot experience, but it won't be affordable either in time or in effort. This means that most copilot customers will be opting into Microsoft control of the presentation layer, just as they do in Office products or the desktop OS."
""
"This doesn't mean your knowledge workers are going to lose total agency. The roadmap for human in the loop expertise is going to be more essential now than ever. The job to be done now is data curation, process authoring, and business rules arbitration. Agents as a brand appeals to the c-level as a way to augment, even replace human capital, but the promise of that is still a rolling five years away, same as it has been for awhile. In the meantime workers will have big part to play in how they slot in the governance and creation of these tools, and customers as well will speak with their dollars on whether these new experiences are truly worth the cost.

When you are wondering why you'd go with Microsoft, is because they have a huge team working on very difficult problems. Leveraging this expertise is super helpful in creating agents for your business.

They are here! After teasing these for a long time - Microsoft has released their vision for agents. "
""
"The most interesting new thing here for veterans in the conversational space is the renewed importance of enterprise compliance, deeper integration with graph search, and the ability to use event based triggering to kick off a process. "
""

Introducing Powerful Chatbot Experiences: Azure Cognitive Services Conversational Language Understanding Integration with Power Virtual Agents"
""
"Power Virtual Agents is pleased to announce that a new integration of Azure Cognitive Services Conversational Language Understanding (CLU) with Microsoft's Power Virtual Agents (PVA), unlocking a whole new level of sophistication and intelligence for your chatbot experiences, is now available in preview. With this integration, you can now harness the power of natural language processing (NLP) to create truly exceptional conversational interfaces."
""
"Read more about this here: https://lnkd.in/g48DEt6f"
" "
"PVA has been empowering organizations to build chatbots without the need for extensive coding or AI expertise. Now, by seamlessly integrating Conversational Language Understanding (CLU), you can take your chatbot interactions to the next level, providing more sophisticated and personalized responses to your users' queries."
""
"Some of the key benefits of using CLU with PVA include:"
""
"1. Enhanced Natural Language Processing (NLP): By leveraging Language Understanding, your chatbot can better understand the nuances of human language. With advanced NLP capabilities, your bot can interpret user intent, extract key information, and respond intelligently. This means your chatbot can handle a wide range of user inputs, even accounting for variations in phrasing and context, resulting in more accurate and meaningful conversations."
""
"2. Improved Intent Recognition and Entity Extraction: Language Understanding allows you to define intents and entities specific to your organization and domain. Your chatbot can now identify user intents with higher precision, enabling it to provide more relevant and context-aware responses. Whether it's extracting customer details, understanding user preferences, or handling complex queries, CLU empowers your chatbot to deliver exceptional user experiences."
""
"3. Seamless Integration and Easy Configuration: Integrating CLU into PVA is a breeze. With a user-friendly interface and onboarding wizard, you can effortlessly configure the language model, intents, and entities that power your chatbot. The intuitive design and simplified setup process ensure that you can start leveraging NLP capabilities without any significant development effort."
""
"4. Rapid Iteration and Continuous Improvement: With CLU, you can continually refine and improve your chatbot's language understanding capabilities. The integration enables you to gather insights from user interactions, identify areas for improvement, and iteratively train your language models. This iterative approach ensures that your chatbot evolves over time, delivering increasingly accurate and context-aware responses."
""

Carrot or the stick? The best thing a senior role can do for a junior is to empower them to make informed decisions, but do the actual going to bat for them on their behalf until they get better at defending their ideas. If you can't protect people to experiment outside their comfort zone, all they will produce is work they think you want to see, and you'll never innovate. #protection #empower #inform #wills

The one thing I’ve always told developers about #chatbots is they cannot be the tentpole of your application initiative, but rather they are a context specific application of your solution where the end user needs it most. "
""
"If you go to market and your solution is only in one chat service context, and not another or does not exist as an external service you lack the flexibility and opportunity to lock yourself into a real “can’t live without it” better mousetrap type scenario. "
""
"Now that the first wave of  #bot explorations have passed, the  #startups that have survived or have been acquired are exactly those that have developed truly useful  #technology, but within the chatbot context. Function remains king over form going forward, and having a good demo isn’t enough anymore. "
